paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant V122I, including penetrance data and individual patient details.

patients.phenotype: homozygous for V122I mutation, presented with cardiac amyloidosis and diffuse cystic lung disease

individual_records.phenotype_details: homozygous for V122I mutation, presented with cardiac amyloidosis and diffuse cystic lung disease
individual_records.evidence_sentence: He was found homozygote for the V122I mutation in transthyretin.

functional_data.summary: The V122I mutation is associated with transthyretin amyloidosis, leading to amyloid deposits in various organs.

variants.segregation_data: Homozygosity is rarely reported and seems to be associated with earlier onset of the disease.
variants.population_frequency: The prevalence is approximately 2–3.5% in African Americans.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and genetic analysis.
variants.additional_notes: This case illustrates the safety and usefulness of cryobiopsy in the setting of DCLD.
key_quotes: A 51-year-old man from Mali... was found homozygote for the V122I mutation in transthyretin.
Homozygosity is rarely reported and seems to be associated with earlier onset of the disease.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR variant was successfully extracted.
